security_audit.summary: All 16 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The static analyzer misidentified security documentation examples as actual vulnerabilities. The skill is a pure prompt-based code review assistant with Read, Glob, and Grep tools only. No network access, command execution, or environment variable access. The findings are legitimate security guidance examples (SQL injection, weak crypto, XSS) showing what to look for during code review - not actual implementation of those patterns.

content.user_title: Review code for quality and security
content.value_statement: Manual code review is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill provides systematic code analysis using Claude to identify bugs, security vulnerabilities, performance issues, and quality concerns across files or entire directories.
actual_capabilities: Read and analyze single files or entire codebases
Identify security vulnerabilities (injection, XSS, auth issues)
Check code style consistency and best practices
Prioritize findings by severity (Critical, High, Medium, Low)
Provide specific line numbers with improvement suggestions
limitations: Does not modify code automatically - only provides recommendations
Cannot execute code to test runtime behavior
Analysis is based on static code inspection only
Cannot access external APIs or services for verification

use_cases.title: Pre-commit Code Review
use_cases.description: Review pull requests and code changes before merging to catch issues early in the development cycle.

use_cases.title: Security Vulnerability Scan
use_cases.description: Scan codebases for common security vulnerabilities and weak authentication patterns.

use_cases.title: Learning Code Patterns
use_cases.description: Understand coding best practices and anti-patterns through constructive feedback on their code.

prompt_templates.title: Basic File Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the file at [filepath] for code quality, bugs, and potential improvements.

prompt_templates.title: Security Focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a security review of [filepath]. Focus on injection vulnerabilities, authentication issues, and data sanitization.

prompt_templates.title: Directory Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Review all files in the [directory] directory. Check for code consistency, duplicate patterns, and architectural issues.

prompt_templates.title: Performance Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze [filepath] for performance bottlenecks, inefficient algorithms, and memory usage issues.

output: HIGH: SQL injection risk on line 45 - user input concatenated directly into query
MEDIUM: Weak password hashing detected on line 78 - consider using bcrypt instead of MD5
LOW: Missing rate limiting on authentication endpoints
HIGH: Duplicate validation logic in functions on lines 12 and 67
MEDIUM: Inconsistent error handling across files
LOW: Variable naming could be more descriptive
MEDIUM: Consider extracting common helper functions
LOW: Missing JSDoc comments on exported functions
CRITICAL: N+1 query pattern on line 23 - database call inside loop
HIGH: Missing cache layer causing repeated expensive computations on line 45
MEDIUM: Consider lazy loading for large data structures

best_practices: Provide specific file paths and line numbers for each issue
Include concrete code examples when suggesting fixes
Prioritize findings by severity to help teams focus on critical issues first
anti_patterns: Reviewing too much code at once - focus on manageable chunks
Using vague language without specific line references
Only pointing out problems without suggesting improvements

faq.question: What programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: Claude Code supports most major languages. The skill works with any language Claude can read and understand.

faq.question: What is the maximum file size or line count for analysis?
faq.answer: Very large files may be truncated. For best results, review individual files under 2000 lines at a time.

faq.question: How does this integrate with my existing workflow?
faq.answer: You can invoke this skill through Claude Code CLI using /code-review command with a file path or directory.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads files locally. No code is sent to external services or stored permanently.

faq.question: Can this skill fix the issues it finds?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides recommendations and suggestions. You must manually apply the fixes to your codebase.

faq.question: How is this different from linters and static analyzers?
faq.answer: This skill provides human-like analysis including architectural concerns, logic errors, and contextual recommendations that go beyond automated rules.
